item.description:
Just because it's still winter in the mountains it doesn't mean that you can't start looking ahead to the spring. Think about it - no snowshoes or crampons, lighter boots, and less "extra" clothing and gear to stuff in your pack.

If you are planning to become more active once the snow melts, or if you simply want to brush up on the knowledge, skills, and abilities that you already have, the Spring Hiking and Backpacking Program being offered by the Boston Chapter of the AMC is a great place to start.

Program Description

This course uses lectures, demonstrations, group activities, and case studies to teach the basics of three-season hiking and backpacking - wilderness safety, clothing, footwear, gear, equipment, nutrition, weather, above treeline travel, overnight trips, etc. It's taught by AMC trip leaders, some of whom also organize hikes with us here at the Random Group of Hikers.

The program runs on five Tuesday nights from 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM. The first three nights (04/17, 04/24, and 05/01) will focus on day hiking while the final night (05/15) will focus on overnight trips. The fourth night (05/08) will be a mix of different topics.

Program Registration

The Program costs $50 for AMC members and $55 for non-members. You can pay via Paypal when you register online by clicking here or you can send a check payable to "HB COMMITTEE" to Chris McCarron c/o Phoenix Realty, 1318 Beacon St Unit #18, Brookline MA 02446. The program fee includes a comprehensive course manual and the current AMC White Mountain Guide book included.

There will be weekend trips offered exclusively or preferentially to participants in this class so you can put your learning in practice. Plus, this is a great opportunity to meet lots of other people who love the outdoors, and to make new friends.

The program takes place at AMC Cabot Auditorium located at 4 Joy Street in Boston, MA. It's near the Park Street T Station, the Massachusetts State House and the Boston Common. Discount parking passes are available for the Boston Common Garage.

Questions

If you have general questions about this program, you can either contact me, the program organizer Robert Knudsen (springhiking@hbbostonamc.org), or the registrar Chris McCarron (chrishbamc@gmail.com).
